questiontext.text: A researcher wants to investigate whether a new medicine against hair loss is effective. Therefore, she randomly divides a group of men into two groups. One group receives the new medicine, while the other group receives a placebo. Hair loss is measured by an ingenious count of the number of lost hairs per day. What statistical test or technique is best suited to test the difference in hair loss between the two groups?

answer.text: A t-test for paired (dependent) samples, to test the effect of medicine use on hair loss.
A regression analysis, with medicine use predicting the number of hairs lost per day.
A chi square test, to test the association between medicine use and hair loss.
A t-test for independent samples, to test the effect of medicine use on hair loss.
